# joined(separator:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Swift ](/documentation/swift)

- [ LazyFilterSequence ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence)

- [ LazyFilterSequence.Iterator ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator)

- [ joined(separator:) ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator/joined(separator:)-4f0oy)

- [ LazyFilterSequence ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence)

- [ LazyFilterSequence.Iterator ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator)

-  joined(separator:) 

Instance Method# joined(separator:)

Returns the concatenated elements of this sequence of sequences, inserting the given separator between each element.iOS 8.0+iPadOS 8.0+Mac Catalyst 13.0+macOS 10.10+tvOS 9.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 2.0+

```
func joined<Separator>(separator: Separator) -> JoinedSequence<Self> where Separator : Sequence, Separator.Element == Self.Element.Element
```

Available when `Element` conforms to `Sequence`.## [ Parameters ](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator/joined(separator:)-4f0oy#parameters)

`separator`A sequence to insert between each of this sequence’s elements.

## [Return Value](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator/joined(separator:)-4f0oy#return-value)

The joined sequence of elements.

## [Discussion](/documentation/swift/lazyfiltersequence/iterator/joined(separator:)-4f0oy#discussion)

This example shows how an array of `[Int]` instances can be joined, using another `[Int]` instance as the separator:



```
let nestedNumbers = [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]
let joined = nestedNumbers.joined(separator: [-1, -2])
print(Array(joined))
// Prints "[1, 2, 3, -1, -2, 4, 5, 6, -1, -2, 7, 8, 9]"

```
